description: Borrowed from French parterre (“on the ground”), from par (“on”) + terre (“ground”).

entries.meaning: (horticulture) A flowerbed, particularly an elevated one.
(horticulture) A garden with paths between such flowerbeds.

definitionGroups.group: (theater) A part of the section of theater seats located on the ground floor, on the same level as the orchestra.

entries.meaning: The part of the ground-floor section nearest the orchestra and the stage; the stalls.
(Britain) The part of the ground-floor section behind the stalls and underneath the galleries; the pit.
(theater, by extension) That part of a theater audience seated in the parterre, sometimes regarded as belonging to a lower social class.
